alfredsnippet.snippet:
Harold Aspden, Discourse No. 3: Gallio Or The Tyranny Of Science

"I can derive that formula [E=Mc2] merely by arguing that all matter comprises electric particles and all electric particles exhibit inertia in just the amount needed to conserve the energy stored by their electric charge. In short, inertia and so E=Mc2 is a manifestation of the Principle of Conservation of Energy and owes nothing to Einstein's philosophy."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The Origin of E=mc^2
